intro: Hermannia complicata, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the rainy season. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture, which helps in reducing water loss. Hermannia complicata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
